description: I can't believe nobody made this sooner. It's too useful. I use Firefox for personal use and Chrome for work, with Firefox as default. Now I can click links in my work messenger instead of copy/paste them.
Was going to write this app myself, then I found Junction, so now I don't need to. Thanks!
summary: Great for loading different links in different browsers

description: I didn't know I needed this until I saw it featured on Youtube. Really slick and just does what it should.
Using it with Fedora Silverblue, does what it says.
I use multiple browsers for work and personal time, this makes it so much simpler to manage.
summary: Simple, fast, does what it's supposed to

description: Simple and effective. Awesome for the case when you have separate flows in different browsers

It is amazing how much simpler my life is with Junction. I use Firefox for personal browsing and Chrome for work, and the amount of times I accidentally opened links on the "wrong" browser was really high. Junction provides a very simple, functional, and elegant solution.
summary: A must-have if you need to use multiple browsers

description:
Works great, though it could use some more customization settings. It doesn't display the LibreWolf icon correctly, and theres nothing I can do to fix that as far as I'm aware.

Really simple app though, so theres not much you can go wrong with it. it's worth having even if you only use it for simple things.

Really wish you could set it as the default for images and videos with a click of a button like you can with browsers, though.
